video.title: Ken Burns: The West
video.synopsis: Historian Ken Burns and his team bring to life the challenges Americans faced in the 19th century as they embarked on westward expansion.

episodes.synopsis: The West begins as the whole world to the people who live there. It becomes a New World when Europeans arrive, a world shaken by incompatible visions.
episodes.title: The People

episodes.synopsis: Americans head west along many pathways -- following the fur trade, fighting for self-determination or seeking religious freedom or a better life.
episodes.title: Empire Upon the Trails

episodes.synopsis: The Gold Rush brings the whole world to the West, as 49ers from Asia, South America and the eastern states scramble for "a share of the rocks."
episodes.title: The Speck of the Future

episodes.synopsis: Civil war comes early to the West. In "Bleeding Kansas," abolitionists battle for free soil. In Utah, federal troops march against Mormon polygamy.
episodes.title: Death Runs Riot

episodes.synopsis: A triumph of the human spirit, the transcontinental railroad opens a new era in the West, carrying homesteaders, cowboys and buffalo hunters.
episodes.title: The Grandest Enterprise Under God

episodes.synopsis: The federal government tightens its grip on the West, but three bold spirits remain defiant: Sitting Bull, Brigham Young and Chief Joseph.
episodes.title: Fight No More Forever

episodes.synopsis: Newcomers arrive by the millions, bringing a spirit of conformity to the West. American Indians, Mormons and Mexicans are forced to make sacrifices.
episodes.title: The Geography of Hope

episodes.synopsis: As settlers race to claim tribal lands, American Indians take up the Ghost Dance, trusting in its power until their hopes are crushed at Wounded Knee.
episodes.title: One Sky Above Us: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: As settlers race to claim tribal lands, American Indians take up the Ghost Dance, trusting in its power until their hopes are crushed at Wounded Knee.
episodes.title: One Sky Above Us: Part 2
